description: From Middle English imbiben, from Latin imbibō, from im- + bibō (“to drink”) (whence also beverage), from Proto-Italic *pibō, from Proto-Indo-European *peh₃-, whence also potable, potion.

verbs.description: imbibe (third-person singular simple present imbibes, present participle imbibing, simple past and past participle imbibed)

entries.meaning: To drink (used frequently of alcoholic beverages).
(obsolete, transitive) To steep; to cause to absorb liquid.
